result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Intentionally Contact - Order for Misdemeanor Conviction

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard Burnett III

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: No reply from defendant or surety.
Notice of bail forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant; Original in file. ($200.00) gj

Defendant Richard Burnett in court with attorney Adam c Essling.  Defendant Richard Burnett in custody.  Peter A. Hahn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pursuant to plea negotations and on motion of the State, Court ordered case DISMISSED to be used as a READ-IN on case 15CM3261.

Attorney Adam c Essling in court, defendant Richard Burnett not in court, in custody.  Patrick D. Winter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Defendant is in custody and was not produced today.  Defense counsel waives the defendant's appearance.
Case adjourned for a plea and sentencing date in Branch 36.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 7, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference scheduled for December 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Adam c Essling in court, defendant Richard Burnett not in court, in custody.  Jaclyn Schwartz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has two cases before the court.
Defense counsel is making his first appearance today and requests brief adjournment.  Court orders case adjourned for status in Branch 36.
Clerk:  jms

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.  Defendant to have no contact with Terri W.

Defendant Richard Burnett in court with attorney Joel Alan Mogren.  Defendant Richard Burnett in custody.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kremers, Branch 36.  Scheduling conference scheduled for November 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Richard Burnett not in court.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
There were no appearances today.
Bench warrant remains in effect.  Jury trial vacated.
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 200.00.

Defendant failing to appear, the Court ordered a bench warrant to issue.  The Court ordered cash bond/signature bond forfeited.  The Court ordered Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office.  The Court ordered that the defendant be REMANDED to the commissioner upon return on the bench warrant

Attorney Danielle L. Shelton in court.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Case is calendared for a final pretrial today.  The defendant failed to appear.
  Defendant failing to appear, the Court ordered a bench warrant to issue.  The Court ordered cash bond/signature bond forfeited.  The Court ordered Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office.  The Court ordered that the defendant be REMANDED to the commissioner upon return on the bench warrant.
Jury trial will remain calendared for 10/07/2015.

Defendant Richard Burnett in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Benjamin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
This case was calendared for a plea and sentencing today.  Defense counsel informs the court that the defendant now wants a jury trial.
   District attorney informs the defense that the offer is revoked.
Case is calendared for final pretrial and  jury trial in Branch 36.
  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Richard Burnett in court with attorney Alexis B Stewart.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case heard off the record. Defense counsel requests case be set for Plea & Sentencing.  Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502. Case adjourned to branch 36.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with TERRI W.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Richard Burnett in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Richard Burnett in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
